alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Jackson; Ritchie; Roane; Wirt (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 2:49PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Calhoun, southwestern Ritchie, Wirt, northwestern Roane and northeastern Jackson Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 248 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Elizabeth, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elizabeth, Grantsville, Reedy, Cherry, Peewee, Palestine, Lucille, Creston, Brohard, Macfarlan, Annamoriah, Leroy, and Munday. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for central, north central and northwestern West Virginia.
